item.title: Rensselaer at Work Co-Term Information Session | March 10
item.description: Monday, March 10, 2025 1:30 PM - 2:00 PM - Learn about the RPI’s online programs which are now available any time, anywhere for coterminal degrees. Expect to hear details about the project-based model, learning through iteration, and how Instructor Mentors provide industry expertise, advice, and mentorship in a targeted and experiential learning environment. Available programs include Mechanical Engineering (M. Eng.), Engineering Science (M.S.) and Systems Engineering & Technology Management (M. Eng.). RSVP to join

item.title: Lally Accelerated Eng/Sci + MBA Program Virtual Info Session | March 13
item.description: Please join the Lally School on Thursday, March 13 at 11:00 AM to learn more about the recent changes to our Accelerated Eng/Sci + MBA Program! All 1st, 2nd and 3rd year engineering and science students are welcome! Save time and money by getting your MBA at the completion of your undergraduate degree. Register for our next information session here.

item.title: RPIrates Monthly Meeting: “Ready for Prime Time: How to Deploy Shiny Apps!” | March 12
item.description: Wednesday, March 12, 6:00pm in AE217. Topic will be “Ready for Prime Time: How to Deploy Shiny Apps!” led by Dr. John Erickson, Director of Research Operations for the Future of Computing Institute (FOCI) at Rensselaer and Chief Instigator of RPIrates. In this session we’ll review coding Shiny apps in R and Python, how to test apps internally on the FOCI Cluster, and how to robustly deploy with Docker and ShinyProxy.

item.title: The McKinney Student Writing Contest Is Now Open!
item.description: The 2025 McKinney Writing Contest is open, and both undergraduate and graduate students are invited to submit entries in a wide range of categories to win cash prizes! Entries are due by midnight on March 11, 2025. Please see the McKinney Writing Contest page for more information, or email the contest committee if you have questions.

item.title: Lecture and Panel Discussion with Media Theorist Jussi Parikka and others | April 4
item.description: Please join us in the CBIS Auditorium from 9am to 5:30pm for a lecture and panel discussion with media theorist Jussi Parikka (Aarhus University) in conversation with art historian/theorist Caroline A. Jones (MIT), architectural theorist/historian Theodora Vardouli (McGill University), architectural historian Michael Abrahamson (University of Utah), and architect Viola Ago (Toronto Metropolitan University).

item.description: Wednesday, March 12, 2025 4:00 PM - 5:30 PM - Join ISSS for a conversation with Cianna Freeman-Tolbert, Partner at Whiteman Osterman & Hanna LLP, to discuss facts about current immigration issues in higher education and how it relates to the RPI community. item.title: Division of Human Resources Professional Development Seminar: “Supervisory Essentials” | March 13
item.description:
Thursday, March 13, 2025 9:00 AM - 4:00 PM - Learn about important topics such as the Employee Value Proposition and Employee Experience, the six fundamental Leadership competencies at Rensselaer, and experience several “Supervisory Simulations” with colleagues. In addition, the importance of coaching employee performance, providing both rewards and recognition, employment law fundamentals and tools for building team capacity will be explored.
